info.bliki.wiki.filter
Class TemplateParser

java.lang.Object
  info.bliki.wiki.filter.WikipediaScanner
      info.bliki.wiki.filter.AbstractParser
          info.bliki.wiki.filter.TemplateParser

public class TemplateParser
extends AbstractParser

A template parser for the first pass in the parsing of a Wikipedia text

See Also:
for the second pass

createParameterMap

public static java.lang.Object[] createParameterMap(char[] src,
                                                    int startOffset,
                                                    int len)
Create a map from the parameters defined in a template call

Returns:
the templates parameters java.util.List at index [0]; the template name at index [1]

createSingleParameter

public static void createSingleParameter(java.lang.String srcString,
                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> namedParameterMap,
                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> unnamedParams)
Create a single parameter, defined in a template call, and add it to the named parmeters map or unnamed parameter list

See Help:Template: Remember that whitespace characters (spaces, tabs, carriage returns and line feeds) are not automatically stripped from the start and end of unnamed parameters (as they are from named parameters). Including such characters (or any other non-visible characters in any parameters) may in some cases affect the template's behaviour in unexpected ways. (Template designers can use {{StripWhitespace}} to remove unwanted whitespace in unnamed parameters.)

Parameters:
srcString -
namedParameterMap - a key/value pairs for name and value of a template parameter
unnamedParams - a list of unnamed parameter values

checkParserFunction

public static int checkParserFunction(java.lang.String plainContent)
Check if this template contains a template function Note: repositions this#fCurrentPosition behind the parser function string if possible

Parameters:
plainContent -
Returns:
the offset behind the ´:´ character at the end of the parser function name or -1 if no parser function can be found in this template.
